intro.description: Pliny is a tool to help you maintain notes about materials you read. This "getting started" page sets up the screen layout for Pliny use (sets the "Pliny Perspective") and points you at some tutorials that will get you help you get started.

item.title: Opening the Pliny Perspective
item.description: If you don't already have the Pliny perspective open, you can establish it here. Eclipse will remember the Pliny perspective next time you start Eclipse, so if you use Eclipse only for Pliny you shouldn't have to do this again.

item.title: Beginning the tutorials
item.description: Now that the Pliny perspective has been set, select the (?) button to the left to enter the Pliny tutorials.
